intro: Spergularia canadensis var. canadensis, commonly known as Canadian sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in disturbed or open habitats. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with five petals, which bloom in the spring and summer months. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it has a creeping growth habit with stolons that root at the nodes. This species is adapted to arid environments and is sometimes considered a pioneer plant in ecological succession.
